First of all I do love their ambience and vibe. The place is huge and perfect for large groups. Decor is rustic with a touch of modern. It has a beautiful open kitchen and storage, you can see crates of fresh produce upstairs. It's buzzing and seems happening, especially on weekends. However that's where my likes end. I've been here several times and made sure to try different items on the menu. All the dishes seemed unseasoned, hokey and just undone. Disappointing, as I feel this place has a lot of potential. There is good variety of fresh, cold-pressed juices and absolutely delicious blueberry quinoa  muffins. And that's the only thing I would come back for.
